free_txt: M.M.

bib_record.title: The energy of delayed neutrons from fission.

free_txt: BEPO reactor.
Background was measured without sample.
He-3 spectrometer.
BEPO reactor.
Thermal neutrons flux in BEPO about 6.E+10 n/cm2/sec.
By varying the irradiation and counting times,
the four longest period were accentuated in turn.
The neutron energy spectrum associated with each period
was interred from measured pulse-height distribution,
using the published data on half-lives and relative
intensities.
About 600,350,700,900 cycles were counted for different
irradiation sequences - Table 2:
t1,t2,t3, sec - times at which the irradiation stopped
and kicksorter gate opened and shut, respectively.
T, sec- Cycle time.
N- number of cycles.
Sequence   t1      t1      t3      T       N
Number of neutrons S-i emitted during different time
sequence ( i - group number) :
Sequence S-1     S-2       S-3       S-4       S-5
Ref.Hughes:
Ref.Keepin:
He-3 neutron spectrometer details.
350 mg of U-235 cylinder in Ni case.
After irradiation the sample was ejected during 0.8 sec
by pneumatic rabbit to counting position outside pile
shield.

0.free_text: Delayed neutron spectrum in arb.units for specificgroup .

free_txt: Spectra for separate delayed-neutron periods were
calculated from the observed composite spectra and the
estimates of S-i of Hughes+ or Keepin+.
Relative intensity and HL (Table 1) were used from:
Energy of delayed neutrons.
Digitizing error of E ( X scale)
Digitizing error of DATA ( Y scale)
Quantization errors:
scale X - 0.002 MeV, scale Y - 0.008 arb.units.
Approx. stat. error ( digitized from Fig4.a)
Other errors from causes:
Correction for variation of wall effect and
He-3(n,p)H-3 cross-section - 6%.
Error due to He-3 recoil from neutrons of
energies > 1 MeV; 10% maximal at zero neutron energy,
become negligible at 100 keV.
Error due to effect of neutron scattering
was estimated by 2 additional measurements.
Errors arising from uncertainties in the data
on half-lives and neutron intensities ( Table 1) were
estimated from two sets of exp.points on Fig.4. to be
about equal or less than stat.error.
Total systematic error is about
+6, -15 % at zero energy, varying slowly to about
+-8% at 1 MeV.
E-RSL-FW -Energy resolution FWHM,digitized from Fig.4a
Fig.4a of J,JNE,3,7,1956.

0.free_text: Delayed neutron spectrum in arb.units for specificgroup .

free_txt: Spectra for separate delayed-neutron periods were
calculated from the observed composite spectra and the
estimates of S-i of Hughes+ or Keepin+.
It was assumed that 4th and 5th periods have identical
spectra . Spectrum of period 4 contains about 10% of
contribution from period 5.
Relative intensity and HL (Table 1) were used from:
Of compiler. On Fig.4d there is an point ( E=0.575 MeV,
data 2.2427 arb.units), which looks like duplicative a
this E; it was not inserted in DATA block.
Energy of delayed neutrons.
Digitizing error of E ( X scale)
Digitizing error of DATA ( Y scale)
Quantization errors:
scale X - 0.002 keV, scale Y - 0.008 arb.units.
Approx. stat. error.
Other errors from causes:
Correction for variation of wall effect and
He-3(n,p)H-3 cross-section - 6%.
Error due to He-3 recoil from neutrons of
energies > 1 MeV; 10% maximal at zero neutron energy,
become negligible at 100 keV.
Error due to effect of neutron scattering
was estimated by 2 additional measurements.
Errors arising from uncertainties in the data
on half-lives and neutron intensities ( Table 1) were
estimated from two sets of exp.points on Fig.4. to be
about equal or less than stat.error.
Total systematic error is about
+6, -15 % at zero energy, varying slowly to about
+-8% at 1 MeV.
E-RSL-FW -Energy resolution FWHM,digitized from Fig.4a
Fig.4d of J,JNE,3,7,1956.
